intro: Zephyranthella tubispatha, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces a tall stem with clustered flowers that range from white to pinkish in color. Zephyranthella tubispatha is a perennial plant that thrives in full sun and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
